com.abwaters.btce
Class BTCE

java.lang.Object
  com.abwaters.btce.BTCE

public class BTCE
extends java.lang.Object

This is the only class required to connect to the BTC-E bitcoin exchange. This class allows you to execute API calls on your account to obtain information and create and cancel trades.

The BTC-E API is documented at the following location https://btc-e.com/api/documentation. 

 BTCE btce = new BTCE() ;
 btce.setAuthKeys(btce_key,btce_secret) ;
 Info info = btce.getInfo() ;
 System.out.println(info.toString()) ;

getTransactionHistory

public BTCE.TransactionHistory getTransactionHistory(int from,
                                                     int count,
                                                     int from_id,
                                                     int end_id,
                                                     java.lang.String order,
                                                     long since,
                                                     long end)
                                              throws BTCE.BTCEException
Returns the transaction history for the account.

All arguments can be either a 0, a null or an empty string "" which will result in the argument being omitted from the API call.

Parameters:
from - the number of the starting transaction to include in the returned results.
count - the number of transactions to return.
from_id - the starting id of the transaction to include in the return results.
end_id - the last id of the transaction to include in the return results.
order - the order to sort the returned results. Can be "ASC" or "DESC". The default value is "DESC" if this value is null or an empty string.
since - starting time frame to include results in unix time stamp format.
end - ending time frame to include results in unix time stamp format.
Returns:
the transaction history.
Throws:
BTCE.BTCEException

                                         int end_id,
                                         java.lang.String order,

                                         long end,
                                         java.lang.String pair)
                                  throws BTCE.BTCEException
Returns the trade history for the account.

All arguments can be either a 0, a null or an empty string "" which will result in the argument being omitted from the API call.

Parameters:

count - the number of transactions to return.
from_id - the starting id of the transaction to include in the return results.
end_id - the last id of the transaction to include in the return results.
order - the order to sort the returned results. Can be "ASC" or "DESC". The default value is "DESC" if this value is null or an empty string.
since - starting time frame to include results in unix time stamp format.
end - ending time frame to include results in unix time stamp format.
pair - the pair to include in the trade history.
Returns:
the trade history.
Throws:
BTCE.BTCEException

getOrderList

public BTCE.OrderList getOrderList(int from,
                                   int count,
                                   int from_id,
                                   int end_id,
                                   java.lang.String order,
                                   long since,
                                   long end,
                                   java.lang.String pair,
                                   int active)
                            throws BTCE.BTCEException
Returns the order list for the account.

All arguments can be either a 0, a null or an empty string "" which will result in the argument being omitted from the API call.

Parameters:
from - the number of the starting transaction to include in the returned results.
count - the number of transactions to return.
from_id - the starting id of the transaction to include in the return results.
end_id - the last id of the transaction to include in the return results.
order - the order to sort the returned results. Can be "ASC" or "DESC". The default value is "DESC" if this value is null or an empty string.
since - starting time frame to include results in unix time stamp format.
end - ending time frame to include results in unix time stamp format.
pair - the pair to include in the order list.
active - include only active orders in the order list.
Throws:
BTCE.BTCEException

trade

public BTCE.Trade trade(java.lang.String pair,
                        java.lang.String type,
                        double rate,
                        double amount)
                 throws BTCE.BTCEException
Execute a trade for the specified currency pair.

Parameters:
pair - the currency pair to trade. This is specified as _, example: "BTC_USD"
type - the type of transaction. Can be "buy" or "sell".
rate - the rate to pay for the transaction in .
amount - the quantity of to buy.
Returns:
the trade results.
Throws:
BTCE.BTCEException

Cancel the specified order.

Parameters:

Throws:

setRequestLimit

public void setRequestLimit(long request_limit)
Limits how frequently calls to the open API for trade history and tickers can be made. If calls are attempted more frequently, the thread making the call is put to sleep for the duration of the time left before the limit is reached.

This is set to 15 second based on a forum post indicating that support specified this limit. Forum post can be read here.

Parameters:
request_limit - call limit in milliseconds

setAuthRequestLimit

public void setAuthRequestLimit(long auth_request_limit)
Limits how frequently calls to the authenticated BTCE can be made. If calls are attempted more frequently, the thread making the call is put to sleep for the duration of the time left before the limit is reached.

This is set to 1 second on the assumption that authenticated (calls using keys) are made infrequently and should receive priority.

Parameters:
auth_request_limit - call limit in milliseconds

setAuthKeys

public void setAuthKeys(java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.String secret)
                 throws BTCE.BTCEException
Sets the account API keys to use for calling methods that require access to a BTC-E account.

Parameters:
key - the key obtained from Profile->API Keys in your BTC-E account.
secret - the secret obtained from Profile->API Keys in your BTC-E account.
Throws:
BTCE.BTCEException

getTicker

public BTCE.Ticker getTicker(java.lang.String pair)
                      throws BTCE.BTCEException
Get the current ticker for the specified currency pair.

Since this call doesn't use authorization, the request limit is typically set higher (10-15 seconds) to avoid abuse.

Parameters:
pair -
Returns:
a Ticker object for the specified pair.
Throws:
BTCE.BTCEException

Get the current rade book for the specified currency pair.

Since this call doesn't use authorization, the request limit is typically set higher (10-15 seconds) to avoid abuse.

Parameters:
pair -
Returns:
an array of TradeDetail objects
Throws:
BTCE.BTCEException
